articles.headline: As Congress Passes Spending Bill, Trump Plans National Emergency to Build Border Wall
articles.snippet: President Trump would proceed with plans to construct barriers on the southwestern border without legislative approval but keep the government open.
articles.abstract: President Trump would proceed with plans to construct barriers on the southwestern border without legislative approval but keep the government open.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump will declare a national emergency as early as Friday to bypass Congress and build his long-promised wall along the nation’s southwestern border even as he agreed to sign a spending package that does not finance it, White House officials said Thursday.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker, Emily Cochrane and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: For Once, Amazon Loses a Popularity Contest
articles.snippet: Amazon’s pullout poses a challenge to one of the company’s bedrock beliefs: that being loved by customers is all that matters.
articles.abstract: Amazon’s pullout poses a challenge to one of the company’s bedrock beliefs: that being loved by customers is all that matters.
articles.lead_paragraph: Amazon’s surprise announcement on Thursday that it was canceling its planned expansion to a new corporate campus in New York was greeted with celebration by local activists and politicians who had opposed the deal, and frustration by local officials — and more than a few real estate agents in Queens — who had eagerly anticipated an influx of well-compensated tech workers.

articles.headline: Blaming Political Climate, Trumps Give Up on New Hotels
articles.snippet: The Trump Organization has shelved plans for two hotel lines that the president’s sons once cast as part of the vision for “the next generation” of the company.
articles.abstract: The Trump Organization has shelved plans for two hotel lines that the president’s sons once cast as part of the vision for “the next generation” of the company.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the early months of the Trump administration, with the president no longer running his family business, his eldest sons embarked on a plan to roll out two new hotel lines in dozens of American cities. It reflected the ambitions of “the next generation of the company,” President Trump’s son Eric said at the time.
articles.byline: By Steve Eder, Ben Protess and Eric Lipton

articles.headline: Even Without Amazon, Tech Could Keep Gaining Ground in New York
articles.snippet: In terms of economic, political and cultural impact, the finance industry dominates. But tech is gaining fast, and is where much of the growth is.
articles.abstract: In terms of economic, political and cultural impact, the finance industry dominates. But tech is gaining fast, and is where much of the growth is.
articles.lead_paragraph: In terms of economic, political and cultural impact, the finance industry dominates. But tech is gaining fast, and is where much of the growth is.
articles.byline: By Ben Casselman, Keith Collins and Karl Russell

articles.headline: She’s a Force of Nature, and She Just Declared War on Peace With the Taliban
articles.snippet: Laila Haidari’s popular Kabul restaurant, where men and women dine freely together, finances her drug treatment center. Now she has a new cause: fighting a peace deal with the Taliban.
articles.abstract: Laila Haidari’s popular Kabul restaurant, where men and women dine freely together, finances her drug treatment center. Now she has a new cause: fighting a peace deal with the Taliban.
articles.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — The driver of a car that was stopped in the middle of the road, blocking traffic, was shocked when a passing motorist rolled down the window and shouted at him, “Dirty donkey.”

articles.headline: The Power of Raw, Honest Stories About Money
articles.snippet: Gaby Dunn, Chanel Reynolds and Vicki Robin were born decades apart. But their books about money have a common thread: Talk about it way, way more often.
articles.abstract: Gaby Dunn, Chanel Reynolds and Vicki Robin were born decades apart. But their books about money have a common thread: Talk about it way, way more often.
articles.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Personal finance professionals live too often in the realm of tools and tactics, optimization and automation. All too frequently, their advice — our advice — is utterly bloodless.

articles.headline: Amazon Invests in Rivian, a Tesla Rival in Electric Vehicles
articles.snippet: The deal is the latest example of how the auto industry is being reshaped by new technologies and nimble companies that have raced ahead of many traditional carmakers.
articles.abstract: The deal is the latest example of how the auto industry is being reshaped by new technologies and nimble companies that have raced ahead of many traditional carmakers.
articles.lead_paragraph: A potential rival to Tesla in electric cars just got a big boost from Amazon.

articles.headline: Trump Declares a National Emergency, and Provokes a Constitutional Clash
articles.snippet: The president’s decision incited instant condemnation from Democrats, who called it an unconstitutional abuse of his authority and vowed to overturn it with Republican support.
articles.abstract: The president’s decision incited instant condemnation from Democrats, who called it an unconstitutional abuse of his authority and vowed to overturn it with Republican support.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump declared a national emergency on the border with Mexico on Friday in order to access billions of dollars that Congress refused to give him to build a wall there, transforming a highly charged policy dispute into a confrontation over the separation of powers outlined in the Constitution.
